alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 6:58PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF MOLOKAI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Molokai in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 830 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 654 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain moving over the west Molokai, with the heaviest rain falling over and west of Maunaloa. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hoolehua, Kualapuu, Maunaloa, Kaunakakai, Kepuhi, Kalaupapa National Park, Kawela and Molokai Airport. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 830 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. A Flood Watch is also in effect until 6 PM HST Tuesday.
